---
title: "Get Fungible Asset Info"
---





import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';



By providing a list of fungible asset types, `GetFungibleAssetInfo` can fetch data such as the symbol, name, decimals, and the asset type itself. This is particularly useful for applications needing to display token details. This is backwards compatible with looking up `Coin` info.

<Aside type="note">
  Try it yourself! You can customize the variables at the bottom of the editor.
</Aside>

{/* <GraphQLEditor query={"type":"mdxJsxAttributeValueExpression","value":"`query GetFungibleAssetInfo($in: [String!], $offset: Int) {\nfungible_asset_metadata(\n  where: {asset_type: {_in: $in}},\n  offset: $offset,\n  limit: 100\n) {\n  symbol\n  name\n  decimals\n  asset_type\n  __typename\n}\n}`","data":{"estree":{"type":"Program","start":542,"end":777,"body":[{"type":"ExpressionStatement","expression":{"type":"TemplateLiteral","start":542,"end":777,"loc":{"start":{"line":13,"column":9,"offset":542},"end":{"line":25,"column":2,"offset":777}},"expressions":[],"quasis":[{"type":"TemplateElement","start":543,"end":776,"loc":{"start":{"line":13,"column":10,"offset":543},"end":{"line":25,"column":1,"offset":776}},"value":{"raw":"query GetFungibleAssetInfo($in: [String!], $offset: Int) {\nfungible_asset_metadata(\n  where: {asset_type: {_in: $in}},\n  offset: $offset,\n  limit: 100\n) {\n  symbol\n  name\n  decimals\n  asset_type\n  __typename\n}\n}","cooked":"query GetFungibleAssetInfo($in: [String!], $offset: Int) {\nfungible_asset_metadata(\n  where: {asset_type: {_in: $in}},\n  offset: $offset,\n  limit: 100\n) {\n  symbol\n  name\n  decimals\n  asset_type\n  __typename\n}\n}"},"tail":true,"range":[543,776]}],"range":[542,777]},"start":542,"end":777,"loc":{"start":{"line":13,"column":9,"offset":542},"end":{"line":25,"column":2,"offset":777}},"range":[542,777]}],"sourceType":"module","comments":[],"loc":{"start":{"line":13,"column":9,"offset":542},"end":{"line":25,"column":2,"offset":777}},"range":[542,777]}}} variables={"type":"mdxJsxAttributeValueExpression","value":"`{\n\"in\": [\"0x1::aptos_coin::AptosCoin\", \"0x1::example_coin::ExampleCoin\"],\n\"offset\": 0\n}`","data":{"estree":{"type":"Program","start":792,"end":885,"body":[{"type":"ExpressionStatement","expression":{"type":"TemplateLiteral","start":792,"end":885,"loc":{"start":{"line":26,"column":13,"offset":792},"end":{"line":29,"column":2,"offset":885}},"expressions":[],"quasis":[{"type":"TemplateElement","start":793,"end":884,"loc":{"start":{"line":26,"column":14,"offset":793},"end":{"line":29,"column":1,"offset":884}},"value":{"raw":"{\n\"in\": [\"0x1::aptos_coin::AptosCoin\", \"0x1::example_coin::ExampleCoin\"],\n\"offset\": 0\n}","cooked":"{\n\"in\": [\"0x1::aptos_coin::AptosCoin\", \"0x1::example_coin::ExampleCoin\"],\n\"offset\": */}

## Variables:

- `$in`: **List of String** - This variable should contain a list of fungible asset types you want to query information for. Ex. `["0x1::aptos_coin::AptosCoin"]`
- `$offset`: **Integer** (Optional) - This variable can be used to paginate through results, specifying how many records to skip before starting to return results.
